alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 22 at 2:08PM MDT until June 23 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY THROUGH 8 PM FRIDAY FOR MOST OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Widespread hot, dry, windy and unstable conditions will return Friday. Poor to fair overnight humidity recovery is expected tonight in western and central New Mexico with good to excellent recoveries in the northeast. Breezy to locally windy conditions combined with several hours of low relative humidity will create critical fire weather conditions in much of central and northern NM. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), North Central Mountains (Zone 120), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122), Northeast Highlands, (Zone 123), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), West Central Mountains (Zone 105), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
